He has been a [[Member of the European Parliament]] for the [[West Midlands (European Parliament constituency)|West Midlands]] [[constituency]] since 1999.[http://www.micandidate.eu/candidate.aspx?idcandidate=2736&idconstituency=129 Michael Cashman's profile on MiCandidate.eu] == Acting == As a child actor he was cast in the role of Oliver Twist in the original run of [[Lionel Bart]]'s musical ''[[Oliver!]]'', but he is possibly best known for his role as [[Colin Russell (EastEnders)|Colin Russell]] in [[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]] [[Television|TV]]'s ''[[EastEnders]]'' – a character remembered for being a participant in the first [[gay]] kiss in a British [[soap opera]]. He also appeared in the ITV drama serial ''[[The Sandbaggers]]'' and the ''[[Doctor Who]]'' story "[[Time-Flight]]". == Politics == Cashman is a founder of [[Stonewall (UK)|Stonewall]], an Honorary Associate of the [[National Secular Society]] and a Patron of [[The Food Chain]], a London-based [[HIV]] charity. In the [[European Parliament]] he is Labour spokesperson on [[human rights]]. A member of the Civil Liberties Committee, Michael Cashman has been a [[rapporteur]] on several key initiatives including an important initiative on [[funeral]]s of those who die in third countries - an issue he was motivated to act on after the death of his own father. In the Petitions Committee, where he is first vice-chair, Michael Cashman has been working on the so-called Spanish Land Grab crisis.[http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/mortgages/homesabroad/article.html?in_article_id=421814&in_page_id=505 Europe to fight Spanish land grab laws | This is Money] He is a trenchant critic of discrimination against minorities within the European Union. He has been leading a cross-party coalition to tackle the rise in homophobia throughout Europe. He has in the past supported the [[Gay rights in Poland|gay pride march]] in [[Warsaw]], which he attended.{{cite news| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/5068318.stm | work=BBC News | title=Fears of Poland's gay community | date=10 June 2006 | accessdate=12 May 2010}} He is also the President of the European Parliament's Intergroup on gay and lesbian issues. Cashman is a member of the [[ACP-EU Joint Parliamentary Assembly]]. In 2007 he was awarded an [[honorary doctorate]] from the [[University of Staffordshire]] for his human rights work.http://www.staffs.ac.uk/graduate/success/index.php That same year he was elected MEP of the Year for Justice and Fundamental Rights by his peers.[http://www.ilga-europe.org/europe/news/michael_cashman_receives_mep_award Michael Cashman receives MEP award / News / Europe / ilga - ILGA Europe] In line with current guidelines the European Parliament pays Paul Cottingham Â£30,000 per annum for his work as Cashman's "Accounts Manager, Personnel Manager and Payroll Administrator".{{cite web|url=http://www.europarl.europa.eu/ep-dif/4532_28-02-2008.pdf|title=Declaration of Member's Financial Interests|last=Cashman|first=Michael|date=2008-02-28|accessdate=2008-07-16}} == Equity == He is the treasurer of [[British Actors' Equity Association|Equity]] and led the campaign to obtain pension rights for members. == Personal life == Cashman registered a [[Civil partnerships in the United Kingdom|civil partnership]] with Paul Cottingham, his partner of over twenty years, on 11 March 2006. == References == {{reflist}} == External links == {{commonscat}} * [http://www.michael-cashman.eu Michael Cashman's web site] * [http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0143659/ Michael Cashman] on [[IMDb]] * [http://www.opsroom.org OpsRoom.org -
